thread.title: Lee County considering creating gun ordinance
thread.title_full: Lee County considering creating gun ordinance

title: Lee County considering creating gun ordinance
text:
Lee County has no gun ordinance, sheriff says officials considering one 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/26/15 4:59 am EDT - Updated: 10/26/15 4:59 am EDT 
DIXON, Illinois â€” The sheriff in Lee County in northern Illinois says authorities are looking into a firearms ordinance because the county doesn't have one. 
The (Dixon) Telegraph reports ( http://bit.ly/1N1fOw8 ) that Lee County Sheriff John Simonton and the county board are considering creating a law to govern what county residents can and cannot do with firearms. 
The issue arose after neighbors complained about noise when a store owner who sells firearms allowed customers to shoot the weapons. Lee County sheriff's deputies investigated and found the store owner wasn't breaking a law because there isn't a law. 
Simonton says he specifically wants to look at how private gun ranges are being used. He says he wants to make sure everyone is safe without impeding anyone's right to bear arms. 
Information from: Dixon Telegraph, http://www.saukvalley.com
